when_to_say: To greet someone
example: Hola, ¿cómo estás? (oh-lah, koh-moh ehs-tahs?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: To express gratitude
example: Gracias por la comida. (grah-syahs por lah koh-mee-dah) - Thank you for the food.

when_to_say: To make a polite request
example: Pásame la sal, por favor. (pah-sah-meh lah sahl, por fah-vor) - Pass me the salt, please.

when_to_say: To say goodbye
example: Adiós, nos vemos mañana. (ah-dee-ohs, nohs beh-mohs mah-nyah-nah) - Goodbye, see you tomorrow.

when_to_say: To express affection
example: El amor es muy importante. (el ah-mor es mooy eem-por-tahn-teh) - Love is very important.

when_to_say: To describe a joyful emotion
example: Estoy muy feliz hoy. (es-toy mooy feh-lees oy) - I am very happy today.

when_to_say: To talk about meals or eating
example: La comida está deliciosa. (lah koh-mee-dah es-tah deh-lee-see-oh-sah) - The food is delicious.

when_to_say: To refer to relatives
example: Mi familia es grande. (mee fah-mee-lee-ah es grahn-deh) - My family is big.

when_to_say: To talk about education
example: Voy a la escuela en la mañana. (voy ah lah ehs-kweh-lah en lah mah-nyah-nah) - I go to school in the morning.

when_to_say: To talk about employment
example: Tengo mucho trabajo hoy. (tehn-goh moo-choh trah-bah-ho oy) - I have a lot of work today.

when_to_say: To refer to drinking water
example: Por favor, dame un vaso de agua. (por fah-vor, dah-meh oon bah-soh deh ah-gwah) - Please, give me a glass of water.

when_to_say: To talk about pets or animals
example: Mi perro es muy amigable. (mee peh-rroh es mooy ah-mee-gah-bleh) - My dog is very friendly.

when_to_say: To refer to a friend
example: Mi amigo vive cerca. (mee ah-mee-goh vee-veh sehr-kah) - My friend lives nearby.

when_to_say: To talk about a place
example: La ciudad es muy grande. (lah syoo-dahd es mooy grahn-deh) - The city is very large.

when_to_say: To describe a street or location
example: La calle está limpia. (lah kah-yeh es-tah leem-pee-ah) - The street is clean.

when_to_say: To talk about duration or weather
example: No tengo tiempo ahora. (noh tehn-goh tyem-poh ah-oh-rah) - I don't have time right now.

when_to_say: To refer to a part of a building
example: La ventana está abierta. (lah ven-tah-nah es-tah ah-byehr-tah) - The window is open.

when_to_say: To talk about physical activity
example: Me gusta correr en el parque. (meh goos-tah koh-rehr en el pahr-keh) - I like to run in the park.

when_to_say: To talk about games or activities
example: Los niños quieren jugar. (los nee-nyos kyeh-ren hoo-gahr) - The children want to play.

when_to_say: To refer to a vehicle
example: El coche es rojo. (el koh-cheh es roh-hoh) - The car is red.

when_to_say: To talk about a doorway
example: Cierra la puerta, por favor. (syeh-rrah lah pwer-tah, por fah-vor) - Close the door, please.

when_to_say: To talk about performing a task
example: Necesito trabajar mañana. (neh-seh-see-toh trah-bah-hahr mah-nyah-nah) - I need to work tomorrow.

when_to_say: To talk about reading material
example: Estoy leyendo un libro interesante. (es-toy leh-yen-doh oon lee-broh een-teh-reh-sahn-teh) - I am reading an interesting book.

when_to_say: To refer to a page in a book or document
example: Lee la página cinco. (leh eh lah pah-hee-nah seen-koh) - Read page five.

when_to_say: To describe the act of writing
example: Voy a escribir una carta. (voy ah ehs-kree-beer oo-nah kahr-tah) - I am going to write a letter.

when_to_say: To talk about writing tools
example: Necesito un lápiz para la tarea. (neh-seh-see-toh oon lah-pees pah-rah lah tah-reh-ah) - I need a pencil for the homework.

when_to_say: To talk about reading books or texts
example: Me gusta leer novelas. (meh goos-tah leh-ehr noh-veh-lahs) - I like to read novels.

when_to_say: To refer to a pen for writing
example: La pluma está en la mesa. (lah ploo-mah es-tah en lah meh-sah) - The pen is on the table.

when_to_say: To refer to a notebook for writing
example: Anota las ideas en el cuaderno. (ah-noh-tah lahs ee-deh-ahs en el kwah-dehr-noh) - Write the ideas in the notebook.

when_to_say: To describe the act of teaching
example: Voy a enseñar matemáticas. (voy ah en-seh-nyar mah-teh-mah-tee-kahs) - I am going to teach math.

when_to_say: To talk about school assignments
example: La tarea es para mañana. (lah tah-reh-ah es pah-rah mah-nyah-nah) - The homework is for tomorrow.

when_to_say: To talk about learning or preparing for exams
example: Necesito estudiar para el examen. (neh-seh-see-toh ehs-too-dyahr pah-rah el ehks-ah-mehn) - I need to study for the exam.

when_to_say: To talk about trips or journeys
example: Me encanta viajar a nuevos lugares. (meh en-kahn-tah vyah-hahr ah nweh-vohs loo-gah-rehs) - I love to travel to new places.

when_to_say: To talk about air travel locations
example: El vuelo sale del aeropuerto. (el vweh-loh sah-leh del ah-eh-roo-pwehr-toh) - The flight departs from the airport.

when_to_say: To talk about identification for travel
example: Necesito mi pasaporte para viajar. (neh-seh-see-toh mee pah-sah-por-teh pah-rah vyah-hahr) - I need my passport to travel.

when_to_say: To talk about accommodation
example: Nos quedamos en un hotel cerca de la playa. (nos keh-dah-mos en oon oh-tehl sehr-kah deh lah plah-yah) - We stayed in a hotel near the beach.

when_to_say: To talk about luggage for a trip
example: No olvides tu maleta. (noh ohl-vee-dehs too mah-leh-tah) - Don’t forget your suitcase.

when_to_say: To talk about seaside locations
example: Pasamos el día en la playa. (pah-sah-mos el dee-ah en lah plah-yah) - We spent the day at the beach.

when_to_say: To describe someone traveling
example: Los turistas están tomando fotos. (los too-ree-stahs es-tahn toh-mahn-doh foh-tohs) - The tourists are taking pictures.

when_to_say: To refer to a tour guide or guidebook
example: La guía nos mostró los mejores lugares. (lah gee-ah nos mos-troh los meh-hoh-rehs loo-gah-rehs) - The guide showed us the best places.

when_to_say: To talk about navigation tools
example: Usamos un mapa para llegar al destino. (oo-sah-mos oon mah-pah pah-rah yeh-gar ahl dehs-tee-noh) - We used a map to reach the destination.

when_to_say: To talk about keepsakes from trips
example: Compré un recuerdo en la tienda. (kohm-preh oon reh-kwehr-doh en lah tyen-dah) - I bought a souvenir at the shop.

when_to_say: To talk about meals or eating
example: La comida en este restaurante es deliciosa. (lah koh-mee-dah en es-teh rehs-tow-rahn-teh es deh-lee-syoh-sah) - The food at this restaurant is delicious.

when_to_say: To talk about places to eat
example: Vamos al restaurante italiano. (vah-mos ahl rehs-tow-rahn-teh ee-tah-lyah-noh) - We are going to the Italian restaurant.

when_to_say: To describe the act of preparing food
example: Me gusta cocinar para mi familia. (meh goos-tah koh-see-nar pah-rah mee fah-mee-lyah) - I like to cook for my family.

when_to_say: To refer to a list of dishes at a restaurant
example: ¿Puedo ver el menú, por favor? (pweh-doh vehr el meh-noo por fah-vor) - Can I see the menu, please?

when_to_say: To talk about sweet food served after a meal
example: El postre de chocolate está delicioso. (el pos-treh deh choh-koh-lah-teh es-tah deh-lee-syoh-soh) - The chocolate dessert is delicious.

when_to_say: To talk about beverages
example: Quiero una bebida fría. (kyeh-roh oo-nah beh-bee-dah free-ah) - I want a cold drink.

when_to_say: To refer to a specific meal or dish
example: El plato principal es pescado. (el plah-toh preen-see-pahl es pehs-kah-doh) - The main dish is fish.

when_to_say: To refer to eating utensils
example: Usa la cuchara para la sopa. (oo-sah lah koo-chah-rah pah-rah lah soh-pah) - Use the spoon for the soup.

when_to_say: To describe bringing or offering food
example: Van a servir la cena a las ocho. (vahn ah sehr-veer lah seh-nah ah lahs oh-choh) - They will serve dinner at eight.

when_to_say: To talk about the taste of food
example: Este plato tiene un sabor único. (es-teh plah-toh tyeh-neh oon sah-bohr oo-nee-koh) - This dish has a unique flavor.

when_to_say: To talk about well-being or health
example: Es importante cuidar tu salud. (es im-pohr-tahn-teh kwee-dahr too sah-lood) - It is important to take care of your health.

when_to_say: To describe someone who is unwell
example: Estoy enfermo, no puedo ir al trabajo. (es-toy en-fehr-moh, noh pweh-doh eer ahl trah-bah-hoh) - I’m sick, I can’t go to work.

when_to_say: To refer to drugs or medical treatments
example: Necesito tomar medicina para la tos. (neh-seh-see-toh toh-mahr meh-dee-see-nah pah-rah lah tohs) - I need to take medicine for the cough.

when_to_say: To refer to a medical professional
example: El doctor me recetó un antibiótico. (el dok-tohr meh reh-seh-toh oon an-tee-byoh-teekoh) - The doctor prescribed me an antibiotic.

when_to_say: To describe physical discomfort
example: Tengo dolor de cabeza. (tehn-goh doh-lohr deh kah-beh-sah) - I have a headache.

when_to_say: To describe a high body temperature
example: Ella tiene fiebre, necesita descansar. (eh-yah tyeh-neh fyeh-breh, neh-seh-see-tah dehs-kahn-sahr) - She has a fever, she needs to rest.

when_to_say: To describe the action of coughing
example: Él no para de toser. (el noh pah-rah deh toh-sehr) - He doesn't stop coughing.

when_to_say: To describe sensitivity to certain substances
example: Tengo alergia al polen. (tehn-goh ah-lehr-hee-ah al poh-lehn) - I have an allergy to pollen.

when_to_say: To talk about immunization or shots
example: Es importante recibir la vacuna contra la gripe. (es im-pohr-tahn-teh reh-see-beer lah vah-koo-nah kohn-trah lah gree-peh) - It's important to get the flu vaccine.

when_to_say: To talk about medical operations or procedures
example: Necesita cirugía para reparar la pierna. (neh-seh-see-tah see-roo-hee-ah pah-rah reh-pah-rahhr lah pyernah) - She needs surgery to repair her leg.

when_to_say: To refer to a job or task
example: Tengo mucho trabajo esta semana. (tehn-goh moo-choh trah-bah-hoh es-tah seh-mah-nah) - I have a lot of work this week.

when_to_say: To describe someone working for a company or organization
example: Ella es una empleada muy eficiente. (eh-yah es oo-nah ehm-pleh-ah-dah mwee eh-fee-syen-teh) - She is a very efficient employee.

when_to_say: To refer to a workspace
example: Trabajo en una oficina grande. (trah-bah-hoh en oo-nah oh-fee-see-nah grahn-deh) - I work in a big office.

when_to_say: To talk about gatherings or appointments
example: La reunión comienza a las diez. (lah reh-oo-nyohn koh-myen-sah ah lahs dyehs) - The meeting starts at ten.

when_to_say: To refer to someone in charge at work
example: El jefe me pidió terminar el proyecto. (el heh-feh meh pee-dee-oh tehr-mee-nahr el proh-yehk-toh) - The boss asked me to finish the project.

when_to_say: To describe a task or plan of work
example: Estamos trabajando en un proyecto nuevo. (es-tah-mohs trah-bah-hahn-doh en oon proh-yehk-toh nweh-voh) - We are working on a new project.

when_to_say: To talk about planned times for tasks
example: Mi horario de trabajo es flexible. (mee oh-rah-ryoh deh trah-bah-hoh es fleh-xee-bleh) - My work schedule is flexible.

when_to_say: To talk about time off from work or school
example: Estoy planeando mis vacaciones para diciembre. (es-toy plah-ne-ahn-doh mees vah-kah-syoh-nehs pah-rah dee-syem-breh) - I am planning my vacation for December.

when_to_say: To talk about travel or journeys
example: El viaje a la playa fue increíble. (el vyah-heh ah lah plah-yah fweh een-kreh-ee-bleh) - The trip to the beach was incredible.

when_to_say: To refer to a place where flights arrive and depart
example: Llegamos al aeropuerto temprano. (yeh-gah-mos ahl ah-eh-roo-pwehr-toh tehm-prah-noh) - We arrived at the airport early.

when_to_say: To refer to a travel document
example: No olvides tu pasaporte. (noh ohl-vee-dehs too pah-sah-pohr-teh) - Don’t forget your passport.

when_to_say: To refer to luggage for travel
example: Empaqué mi ropa en una maleta grande. (em-pah-keh mee roh-pah en oo-nah mah-leh-tah grahn-deh) - I packed my clothes in a big suitcase.

when_to_say: To refer to travel or event admission
example: Compré un boleto de avión. (kohm-preh oon boh-leh-toh deh ah-vyohn) - I bought a plane ticket.

when_to_say: To talk about a place you are traveling to
example: Nuestro destino es París. (nwehs-troh dehs-tee-noh es pah-rees) - Our destination is Paris.

when_to_say: To refer to someone visiting a place
example: Muchos turistas visitan esta ciudad. (moo-chos too-ree-stahs vee-see-tahn es-tah syoo-dahd) - Many tourists visit this city.

when_to_say: To refer to someone or something providing information about a place
example: El guía nos mostró los mejores lugares. (el gee-ah nohs mohs-troh los meh-hoh-res loo-gah-rehs) - The guide showed us the best places.

when_to_say: To talk about accommodations
example: El hotel tiene una vista hermosa. (el oh-tehl tyeh-neh oo-nah vees-tah ehr-moh-sah) - The hotel has a beautiful view.

when_to_say: To talk about items bought as memories of a trip
example: Compré un recuerdo para mi familia. (kohm-preh oon reh-kwehr-doh pah-rah mee fah-mee-lyah) - I bought a souvenir for my family.
